issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Description:
When running the Facebook tests, and bringing up the login dialog, choosing "cancel" will load a "page not found" page. See attached image.

Steps to reproduce:
1) Install KitchenSink on Verizon iPhone
2) Navigate to Mashups>Facebook>login/Logout
3) Click login
4) when the login window is presented, click cancel

Result:
Page not found loads

Expected Result:
Dialog is disposed and user returned to test

Notes:
Occurs with 1.6.2
fields.summary: iOS: KitchenSink Mashups>Facebook>login/Logout, canceling login dialog loads odd "page not found"
fields.environment: Verizon iPhone 4 (4.2.6) , Titanium Studio, build: 1.0.0.201105131803, Titanium SDK version: 1.7.X r3ecace11

comments.body: What do we mark this one as? Can't reproduce? Facebook has changed their web page to no longer have the cancel button on login, and the cancel buttons are doing the right thing now. Looks like it's been fixed, but the issue was on Zuckerberg's end.
Mark as fixed once the current Facebook update pull request is processed.
Resolving ticket as invalid as this version of Kitchen Sink is no longer in use.
